newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices gain on fresh state buying.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices gain on fresh state buying.

text.p: Indian cotton prices showed modest gains on Monday on fresh purchases by the state-owned Cotton Corporation of India despite low mill buying, dealers said.
The government last week allowed the Corporation to export 100,000 bales (170 kg each), triggering fresh purchases by the Corporation.
In spot deals Punjab saw-ginned rose to 1,440/1,650 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) from 1,425/1,600 rupees. Bengal-deshi gained by 10 rupees to 830/860 rupees per maund.
Gujarat Sankar-4 (long-staple) rose by 300 rupees to 18,500/19,000 rupees per candy (355.56 kg).
